title: Harnessing innovations for food security to improve livelihoods

tasks.task: Participate in a site meeting to discuss the selection of a spokesperson for an innovation platform.
subtasks: Listen to and understand the main message regarding the need for a trusted messenger.
Recognize the potential sidelining of traditional leaders in innovation processes.
Acknowledge the importance of involving non-scientists and non-technocrats in policy processes.
Understand the call for empowering local communities with scientific evidence.
Identify the role of sustainability in involving community members affected by problems.

tasks.task: Address the weakness of African research institutions.
subtasks: Analyze the lack of investment in research within African institutions.
Highlight the underappreciation of research's role in development.
Identify the issue of researchers conducting isolated work without engaging farmers.
Propose using African funds to bolster research institutions' capabilities.

tasks.task: Advocate for policies created from bottom-up evidence.
subtasks: Discuss the current problem of top-down policy creation.
Emphasize the need for policies informed by practitioner evidence.
Explain the role of innovation platforms in facilitating the movement of evidence from project to policy levels.
Encourage the integration of various actors as drivers of change in the innovation platform approach.

tasks.task: Highlight the importance of involving affected community members in problem-solving.
subtasks: Understand the need for those directly affected by problems to be part of the solution.
Recognize the value of partnership between community members and researchers in delivering development options.
Appreciate the innovative aspect of involving practitioners in evidence generation and policy feeding.
